cyclone.name: FLORENCE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 miles ESE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest toward the North and northern South Carolina coastline, then expected to slow and meander near/just inland of the coast through the weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Cape Fear – Wilmington, North Carolina area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (includes Charleston area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warning: South Santee River SC to Duck NC; Storm Surge Warning: South Santee River SC to Duck NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern and central South Carolina coast and most of the North Carolina coast
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) likely Thursday night through Saturday; brief hurricane-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 2–4 ft inundation above ground possible in and around Charleston Harbor, especially at high tide.
weather_observation.rainfall: 5–10 inches of rain with locally higher amounts could cause flash flooding in the Charleston area.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large and dangerous surf, rip currents, and the potential for isolated tornadoes inland will hamper port operations.
